First of all, I would like to thank everyone for their efforts with Rawr. This is a great piece of software that I use often.

Even though the optimizer is very CPU Intensive, I find it very helpful to run Rawr on my netbook which is running at 1024x600 resolution. When doing this, I lose the bracer and bottom trinkets from the screen. Would it be possible to either add a scroll bar or resize the item icons when the resolution is under 1024x768? I'm not an expert programmer, but I'm pretty sure the former is easier, but would prefer the latter if possible. While many people have low-cost netbooks, I understand that netbooks are still a "new craze" and would be willing to test a lower-resolution friendly version as well as provide screenshots or any information that would make this easier for the Rawr team.

Runesaber
Arthas
Yeah, if you wanted to post a screenshot of Rawr, maximized, that'd help.

Here's one with standard XP theme. If you want one with classic theme let me know. Thanks a ton for considering this.

http://i36.tinypic.com/mhge91.jpg
I'd like to see this feature as well, same resolution on my netbook. Having a netbook in bed before light out doing the tweaking is nice. :)
I'd also like the option to hide all icons if possible. Maybe replaced by two characters like in armorylite.com (it has an option to hide icons)
What's the lowest vertical resolution that netbooks typically have? 480?

1024x600 is common

Sent from my jPhone

It's on our list of things to do, still.

Hello, I am currently considering the purchase of  a netbook for the purpose of running this program.  lol, addict I guess.  I use a mac and dont have a pc, so the cheapeset option I think is a netbook to be able to use this program. 

 

So, 2 questions.  Has there been an icon size fix for small screens?  Or a specific screen resolution to use to make the bottom trinkets viable? 

My other question is, will there be a mac compatible rawr in the near future?

Rawr2 will not be compatible with these types of low resolutions. Rawr3 is already set up for it.

Send Astry an email about getting into the Rawr3 Beta (which is cross-platform).
A Mac running Mono something-or-rather should be able to run the current Rawr.  Rawr3 is in the near future, which will be a Silverlight (cross-platform, web-based) program.
